name: English Oak
description: A large deciduous tree native to Europe, known for its strength and longevity.
long_description: The English Oak is one of the most common and important trees in temperate forests across Europe. It can grow up to 40 meters tall and live for over 1,000 years. The tree's leaves are lobed and turn golden brown in autumn before falling.

name: Sugar Maple
description: A deciduous tree known for its brilliant fall colors and maple syrup production.
long_description: The Sugar Maple is native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and live for over 300 years. Its leaves are broad and lobed, turning vibrant shades of yellow, orange, and red in autumn.

name: Japanese Cherry
description: An ornamental cherry tree famous for its spring blossoms.
long_description: The Japanese Cherry is celebrated for its stunning spring display of pink or white blossoms. It grows to about 8-12 meters tall and has a graceful spreading form.

name: European Beech
description: A majestic deciduous tree with smooth gray bark.
long_description: The European Beech is a large tree reaching heights of 30-40 meters. It has distinctive smooth gray bark and dense foliage that turns golden-bronze in autumn.

name: Red Pine
description: A tall evergreen tree with reddish bark and long needles.
long_description: The Red Pine is a straight-trunked evergreen that can grow to 35 meters. It has distinctive reddish bark and pairs of long, dark green needles.
